cookieManagement.title: Cookie Management
cookieManagement.description: Control your privacy on LexOrbital. Choose which cookies we can use to improve your experience.

activeCookies.title: Currently active cookies
activeCookies.subtitle: Total number of cookies allowed on this site

whatIsCookie.title: What is a cookie?
whatIsCookie.paragraph1: Cookies are small text files stored on your device when you visit a website. They allow the site to remember your actions and preferences over a period of time.
whatIsCookie.paragraph2: LexOrbital is not designed to collect sensitive personal data. We only use essential cookies for site functionality and, with your consent, cookies to improve your experience.

necessary.title: ðŸ”µ Necessary Cookies
necessary.subtitle: (Required)
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the site to function. They cannot be disabled as they provide essential functions such as security and authentication.

functional.title: ðŸŸ¢ Functional Cookies
functional.subtitle: (Optional)
functional.description: These cookies enhance your experience by remembering your preferences and choices (theme, interface layout).

analytics.title: ðŸŸ  Analytics Cookies
analytics.subtitle: (Optional)
analytics.description: These cookies collect anonymous data about site usage to help us improve our services and understand how users interact with LexOrbital.

marketing.title: ðŸ”´ Marketing Cookies
marketing.subtitle: (Optional)
marketing.description: These cookies would be used to display relevant advertisements. LexOrbital currently does not use any marketing cookies.

actions.note: You can modify your preferences at any time by returning to this page.

retention.title: Retention period
retention.description: Cookies are retained for the duration specified in each category. Upon expiration, they are automatically deleted.

recipients.title: Data recipients
recipients.description: Only LexOrbital has access to data from necessary and functional cookies. Analytics cookies may be shared with Google Analytics (anonymized).

gdpr.title: Your GDPR rights
gdpr.description: You have the right to access, rectify, delete and object to the processing of your personal data. To exercise these rights, please see our Contact page.

modal.title: Preferences saved
modal.message: Your cookie preferences have been successfully saved. {{count}} cookie is currently active.
modal.message_plural: Your cookie preferences have been successfully saved. {{count}} cookies are currently active.

object.title: 1. Object and Scope
object.paragraph1: These Terms of Use govern access to and use of the LexOrbital platform and services. By accessing this platform, users acknowledge having read and accepted these terms in their entirety.
object.paragraph2: LexOrbital is a platform for visualizing software architecture evolution and module interactions. The service is provided on a subscription basis with different access levels depending on user role.

access.title: 2. Access and Use
access.description: Access to the platform requires user authentication. Users are responsible for:

items.credentials: â€¢ Maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials
items.equipment: â€¢ Ensuring their equipment meets technical requirements
items.laws: â€¢ Using the platform in accordance with applicable laws
items.security: â€¢ Not attempting to circumvent security measures

ip.title: 3. Intellectual Property
ip.description: All content, structure, design elements, and software code of the LexOrbital platform are protected by intellectual property rights. Unless explicitly authorized:

items.reproduce: â€¢ Users may not reproduce, modify, or distribute platform content
items.proprietary: â€¢ The modular architecture and conceptual framework remain proprietary
items.api: â€¢ API access is governed by separate licensing agreements
items.opensource: â€¢ Open-source components are governed by their respective licenses (see References)

liability.title: 4. Limitations of Liability
liability.description: LexOrbital strives to provide reliable service but makes no guarantees regarding:

items.availability: â€¢ Continuous, uninterrupted availability (SLA terms apply separately)
items.accuracy: â€¢ Accuracy or completeness of visualizations (data is provided as-is)
items.compatibility: â€¢ Compatibility with all third-party systems
items.outcomes: â€¢ Outcomes resulting from architectural decisions made using platform insights

liability.acknowledgment: Users acknowledge that LexOrbital is a tool for analysis and visualization, not a substitute for professional architectural consultation.

modifications.title: 5. Modifications
modifications.description: LexOrbital reserves the right to modify these Terms of Use at any time. Users will be notified of material changes via:

items.email: â€¢ Email notification to registered account
items.trustCenter: â€¢ Update published in Trust Center

modifications.acceptance: Continued use of the platform after notification constitutes acceptance of modified terms. Users who disagree may terminate their account as outlined in Section 7.

data.title: 6. Data Protection
data.description: User data is processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy and applicable data protection regulations (GDPR, CCPA). Key principles:

items.minimal: â€¢ Minimal data collection (only what is necessary for service provision)
items.transparent: â€¢ Transparent processing (see Privacy Policy for details)
items.rights: â€¢ User rights (access, rectification, deletion, portability)
items.security: â€¢ Secure storage and transmission (encryption at rest and in transit)

termination.title: 7. Termination
termination.description: Users may terminate their account at any time via account settings. Upon termination:

items.access: â€¢ Access to the platform will cease immediately
items.deletion: â€¢ User data will be deleted within 30 days (unless legal retention required)
items.refund: â€¢ Prepaid subscription fees are non-refundable (pro-rata basis)

termination.suspension: LexOrbital may suspend or terminate accounts for violations of these Terms, with notice where feasible.

contact.title: Questions or Concerns
contact.description: For questions regarding these Terms of Use, please contact our legal department:

sustainability.title: Digital Sustainability Approach
sustainability.paragraph1: LexOrbital V1 has been designed with environmental impact in mind, following principles of digital eco-conception to minimize resource consumption and energy usage.
sustainability.paragraph2: The minimalist, structural approach serves both functional and environmental purposes, reducing unnecessary data transfer and computational overhead.

visualComplexity.title: Minimal Visual Complexity
visualComplexity.description: Black and white color scheme eliminates unnecessary color processing. No images, gradients, or complex visual effects reduce rendering requirements.

codeStructure.title: Optimized Code Structure
codeStructure.description: Modular architecture prevents code duplication. Semantic HTML reduces markup overhead. No external dependencies for visual effects or animations.

typography.title: Efficient Typography
typography.description: Single font family (Roboto) minimizes font loading. System fonts reduce external resource requests.

staticContent.title: Static Content Priority
staticContent.description: V1 focuses on static content that can be efficiently cached and served with minimal server processing.

items.pageWeight: â€¢ Target page weight: < 100KB per page
items.httpRequests: â€¢ Minimal HTTP requests through consolidated resources
items.tracking: â€¢ No external tracking or analytics scripts
items.caching: â€¢ Aggressive caching strategies for static content
items.markup: â€¢ Semantic markup reduces DOM complexity

futureGoals.title: Future Eco-conception Goals
futureGoals.description: Subsequent versions will maintain these core efficiency principles while introducing necessary features:

items.monitoring: â€¢ Continued monitoring of page weight and performance
items.carbonFootprint: â€¢ Carbon footprint assessment for platform operations
items.optimization: â€¢ Optimization of any dynamic features introduced in V2+

userContribution.title: User Contribution
userContribution.description: Users contribute to eco-conception by experiencing a fast-loading, low-bandwidth platform that respects both their time and environmental resources. The structural simplicity of V1 demonstrates that effective digital experiences need not rely on resource-intensive design.

commitment.title: Commitment to Accessibility
commitment.paragraph1: LexOrbital is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for all users, including those with disabilities. We strive to meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards as our minimum baseline.
commitment.paragraph2: The V1 architecture has been designed with structural clarity and semantic HTML to support assistive technologies and ensure accessible navigation.

items.semantic: â€¢ Semantic HTML structure with proper heading hierarchy
items.contrast: â€¢ High contrast black and white color scheme (21:1 ratio)
items.focus: â€¢ Clear focus indicators on interactive elements
items.labels: â€¢ Descriptive labels and ARIA attributes where appropriate
items.navigation: â€¢ Consistent navigation structure across all pages

limitations.title: Known Limitations
limitations.description: As a V1 prototype, certain accessibility features remain under development:

items.screenReader: â€¢ Screen reader optimization in progress
items.altText: â€¢ Alternative text for placeholder visual elements not yet complete
items.responsive: â€¢ Responsive design for mobile screen readers requires enhancement

feedback.title: Feedback and Assistance
feedback.description: We welcome feedback on accessibility issues or barriers encountered while using the platform. Please use the contact form to report any accessibility concerns, and we will work to address them in future iterations.

improvements.title: Ongoing Improvements
improvements.description: Accessibility is an evolving priority. Each version of LexOrbital will incorporate enhanced accessibility features based on user feedback and updated standards.

primaryHosting.title: Primary Hosting
primaryHosting.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Data centers: EU-West-1 (Ireland), EU-Central-1 (Frankfurt)
Compliance: ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type 2, GDPR

cdn.title: CDN & Edge Computing
cdn.description:
Cloudflare, Inc.
Global edge network with European data residency
Security: DDoS protection, WAF, SSL/TLS encryption

backup.title: Backup & Disaster Recovery
backup.description:
Geographic redundancy across multiple EU regions
RTO: 4 hours | RPO: 15 minutes
Encrypted backups with versioning

platform.title: LexOrbital Platform
platform.paragraph1: All rights reserved. The LexOrbital platform, including its modular architecture framework, visualization engine, and proprietary algorithms are protected by copyright and trade secret law.
platform.paragraph2: Unauthorized reproduction, modification, or commercial exploitation is prohibited and may result in legal action.

openSource.title: Open Source Components
openSource.description: LexOrbital incorporates open source software governed by their respective licenses. Full attribution and license information available in our References page.
openSource.licenses:
â€¢ React (MIT License)
â€¢ Tailwind CSS (MIT License)
â€¢ TypeScript (Apache 2.0 License)
â€¢ Additional dependencies listed in package.json

trademarks.title: Trademarks
trademarks.description: "LexOrbital" and the LexOrbital logo are trademarks of LexOrbital SAS. Use of these marks without permission is prohibited.

security.title: Responsible Disclosure â€” Security Vulnerabilities
security.description: LexOrbital is committed to security and welcomes responsible disclosure of vulnerabilities.

step1.label: 1. Report via secure channel:
step1.pgp: PGP key available on our Security page

items.description: â€¢ Vulnerability description and impact assessment
items.contact: â€¢ Your contact information for follow-up

items.assessment: â€¢ Initial assessment within 5 business days
items.updates: â€¢ Regular updates throughout remediation process

safeHarbor.title: Safe Harbor
safeHarbor.description: We will not pursue legal action against security researchers who:

items.goodFaith: â€¢ Report vulnerabilities in good faith
items.privacy: â€¢ Avoid privacy violations and data destruction
items.exploit: â€¢ Do not exploit vulnerabilities beyond proof of concept
items.time: â€¢ Allow reasonable time for remediation before public disclosure

recognition.title: Recognition
recognition.description: With your permission, we will acknowledge your contribution in our Security Hall of Fame (see Security page).

availability.label: Service Availability:
availability.description: While we strive for 99.9% uptime, LexOrbital is provided "as is" without guarantees of uninterrupted service. Planned maintenance windows are announced 72 hours in advance.

accuracy.label: Data Accuracy:
accuracy.description: Architecture visualizations are generated from user-provided data. LexOrbital does not warranty the accuracy or completeness of visualizations.

thirdParty.label: Third-Party Services:
thirdParty.description: Integrations with third-party tools are subject to their availability and terms of service. LexOrbital is not responsible for third-party service failures.

professional.label: Professional Advice:
professional.description: LexOrbital is a technical tool, not a substitute for professional architectural consultation, legal advice, or security auditing services.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.description: These terms and any disputes arising from use of LexOrbital are governed by French law.

mediation.title: Mediation
mediation.description: In case of dispute, parties agree to attempt good-faith mediation before legal proceedings. Contact our legal department to initiate mediation.

jurisdiction.title: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.description: Exclusive jurisdiction for legal proceedings: Commercial Courts of Paris, France.

legal.label: Legal Department
legal.emailLabel: Send an email to legal department

security.label: Security Team
security.emailLabel: Send an email to security team

privacy.label: Privacy Officer
privacy.emailLabel: Send an email to privacy officer

corePrinciples.title: Core Ethical Principles
corePrinciples.description: LexOrbital operates according to principles of transparency, user respect, and responsible technology development. This charter outlines our ethical commitments and deontological obligations.

architectural.title: Architectural Transparency
architectural.description: All system structures, module relationships, and architectural decisions are documented and made visible to users. No hidden functionality or opaque operations.

honest.title: Honest Representation
honest.description: V1 is clearly identified as a conceptual prototype. Placeholder elements are explicitly labeled. Future capabilities are marked as such, not presented as current features.

minimal.title: Minimal Data Collection
minimal.description: V1 collects no user data, stores no personal information, and uses no tracking mechanisms. This principle will guide all future versions.

byDesign.title: Privacy by Design
byDesign.description: Privacy considerations are integrated into the architectural foundation, not added as an afterthought.

universal.title: Universal Access
universal.description: The platform is designed to be accessible to users of all abilities, with high contrast, semantic structure, and keyboard navigation as foundational elements.

language.title: Language Neutrality
language.description: While V1 uses English/French, the structural approach is language-agnostic, facilitating future internationalization.

environmental.title: 4. Environmental Responsibility
environmental.description: Digital sustainability is a core ethical obligation. The minimalist design approach reflects our commitment to reducing environmental impact through efficient code, minimal resources, and thoughtful technical choices.

attribution.title: Attribution and Recognition
attribution.description: All external contributions, influences, and references are properly documented and credited.

documentation.title: Open Documentation
documentation.description: Technical documentation and architectural decisions are openly shared to contribute to collective knowledge.

userAgency.title: 6. User Agency and Control
userAgency.description: Users maintain full control over their interaction with the platform. No manipulative design patterns, dark patterns, or coercive elements. Clear navigation and explicit functionality respect user autonomy.

enforcement.title: Enforcement and Accountability
enforcement.description: This charter guides all development decisions and feature implementations. Violations of these principles are taken seriously and addressed through:

items.audits: â€¢ Regular ethical audits of platform features
items.feedback: â€¢ User feedback mechanisms for ethical concerns
items.documentation: â€¢ Transparent documentation of ethical decision-making
items.refinement: â€¢ Continuous refinement of ethical guidelines

evolution.title: Evolution of Ethics
evolution.description: This charter will evolve with the platform. As new features are introduced, ethical considerations will be documented and integrated into the development process. User feedback and emerging ethical standards will inform updates to this charter.

overview.title: Security at LexOrbital
overview.paragraph1: Security is fundamental to LexOrbital's architecture and operations. We implement defense-in-depth strategies across all layers of our platform to protect user data and maintain service integrity.
overview.paragraph2: This page provides transparency about our security practices and offers channels for security researchers and users to report vulnerabilities.

howToReport.title: How to Report a Security Vulnerability

secureCommunication.title: 1. Secure Communication
secureCommunication.description: Report security issues via encrypted email:
secureCommunication.pgpNote: For sensitive reports, use our PGP key (available below)

items.description: â€¢ Detailed description of the vulnerability
items.impact: â€¢ Potential impact assessment (CVSS score if available)
items.proof: â€¢ Proof of concept (code, screenshots, or video)
items.contact: â€¢ Your contact information for follow-up

items.thirdParty: âœ— Third-party services we don't control
items.spam: âœ— Spam or email header manipulation

items.data: â€¢ Do not access, modify, or delete user data beyond proof of concept
items.accounts: â€¢ Limit testing to your own accounts when possible
items.exploit: â€¢ Do not exploit vulnerabilities for personal gain
items.privacy: â€¢ Respect user privacy and data protection regulations
items.disclosure: â€¢ Provide reasonable time for remediation before public disclosure
items.goodFaith: â€¢ Act in good faith to avoid service disruption

bugBounty.title: Bug Bounty Program
bugBounty.description: We reward security researchers who help us identify vulnerabilities.
bugBounty.note: * Rewards are determined based on severity, quality of report, and novelty. Duplicate reports receive reduced rewards on a first-come basis.

hallOfFame.title: Security Hall of Fame
hallOfFame.description: We thank the following security researchers for their responsible disclosure:

bob.name: Bob Mueller â€” Nov 2024
bob.description: High: Stored XSS in module annotations

carol.name: Carol Zhang â€” Oct 2024
carol.description: Medium: Information disclosure in API responses

hallOfFame.more: More researchers to be added as reports are resolved

pgp.title: PGP Public Key
pgp.description: For encrypted communications, use our PGP public key:
pgp.key:
-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----

mQINBGXYZ1cBEAC9... [truncated for display]
[Full PGP key available via download]

-----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----

items.password: â€¢ Use strong, unique passwords (minimum 12 characters)
items.sessions: â€¢ Regularly review active sessions and authorized applications
items.credentials: â€¢ Never share your credentials or API keys

items.classify: â€¢ Classify your data appropriately before uploading
items.rbac: â€¢ Use role-based access controls (RBAC) for team members
items.audit: â€¢ Regularly audit who has access to sensitive architectures
items.logging: â€¢ Enable audit logging for compliance requirements

items.report: â€¢ Report unusual account activity immediately
items.verify: â€¢ Verify email authenticity (check sender domain)
items.phishing: â€¢ Be cautious of phishing attempts impersonating LexOrbital
items.contact: â€¢ Contact support if you suspect a security incident
